intro: Pseudolmedia spuria, commonly known as the false bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Pseudolmedia spuria is relatively hardy and can thrive in a variety of temperate climates.
